instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message:
Hi I have now MacBook Air 1466 820-3437-B. Laptop is slow, loading system very long (but after load in system it works fine)and want load installation USB stick. It was slightly liquid damaged around U1900 main board has been cleaned and inspected. I tested laptop with ASD, no sensor or other fault found. New EFi with old dumped bin and ME region cleaned doesn't resolve issue.
All main rails are ok. 
Any idea what could slowing down this Mac ?
Also I tried new battery other trackpad with new flex, new power board with new flex, other ssd different USB key with system no luck. 
Anyone have something like this before? 
Any help much appreciated. 
Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message: Replaced U1900? Could be an SMC issue too, but it's hard to say. Corrosion is your best hint.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message: Thanks for response I checked under microscope no corrosion on one legs or connections or parts. I expected in first place it will be thermal sensor issue that how it looks like but no errors. Do you think if there is no errors SMC still could be faulty? It will be very unusual unless some liquid damage go under. I will check it tomorrow and report here if SMC from donor board resolve issue.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message:
Try disconnecting camera.
Also try without LIO flex connected; fan will go high as normal in this case.

Run HWMonitor and see if any temp goes crazy.

"ME region cleaned"
How did you clean it?
On the forum should already be posted links for clean ME region for sure...

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message:
I checked what you said, without LIO flex or disconnected camera is same. 
HWMonitor shows right temps nothing unusual. 
I search forum trying to find this bios but this with I found doesn't work, link is not active any more. Could you clean my original bios for me please. 
I use method with swiping ME region with clean one in hex code editor.
Thanks for help

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3437-B laptop very slow
threads.message:
Then is not clean ME issue.
This could be internal PCH issue.
